ผู้ก่อตั้ง Ethereum Vitalik Buterin ขาย ETH มูลค่า 6.6 ล้านดอลลาร์

Ethereum Founder Vitalik Buterin Dumps $6.6 Million Worth of ETH

1d ago//Vinod Dsouza
bitcoinethereum
AI

Summary

TH

Vitalik Buterin ผู้ร่วมก่อตั้ง Ethereum ได้ทำการขายสินทรัพย์ ETH จำนวน 2,961.5 เหรียญ หรือมูลค่าประมาณ 6.6 ล้านดอลลาร์ ในราคาเฉลี่ย 2,228 ดอลลาร์ ในช่วงที่ตลาดคริปโตกำลังผันผวน ข้อมูลจาก Lookonchain ระบุว่าการขายนี้ยังคงดำเนินอยู่ ซึ่งทำให้เกิดความกังวลว่าราคาอาจจะร่วงลงต่อเนื่องเนื่องจากวาฬขนาดใหญ่กำลังทำกำไร ขณะนี้ Ethereum กำลังเผชิญกับแรงกดดันอย่างหนักหลังจากราคาดิ่งลง 34% ในช่วงหนึ่งเดือนที่ผ่านมา และนักวิเคราะห์คาดการณ์ว่าราคาอาจตกลงถึงระดับ 1,800 ดอลลาร์ การขายครั้งนี้เกิดขึ้นพร้อมกับการที่ Buterin ได้วิจารณ์ Layer-2 solutions ที่ขยายตัวช้ากว่า Layer-1 และขาดการกระจายอำนาจ

EN

Ethereum founder Vitalik Buterin has sold 2,961.5 ETH worth approximately $6.6 million at an average price of $2,228, as the cryptocurrency market faces a downturn. According to on-chain data from Lookonchain, the selling is still ongoing, sparking fears that the price could drop further as industry whales take profits. Ethereum is currently under significant pressure, having declined 34% over the past month, with analysts predicting a potential crash to the $1,800 level. This sell-off coincides with Buterin's recent criticism of Layer-2 solutions, where he noted that Layer-1 blockchains are scaling faster and that L2 networks are lacking in decentralization.

Key Points

  • Vitalik Buterin sold 2,961.5 ETH ($6.6 million) at an average price of $2,228.
  • On-chain data suggests the selling is ongoing, adding to bearish market sentiment.
  • Ethereum has dropped 34% in a month, with predictions of a fall to $1,800.
  • Buterin recently criticized Layer-2 solutions for scaling issues and lack of decentralization.

Article

The cryptocurrency market is trading in the red this week after Bitcoin plunged to the $70,000 level. The price dip is making industry’s bigwigs jump ship and book profits before a major crash occurs. On the heels of the downturn, Ethereum founder Vitalik Buterin dumped $6.6 million worth of ETH at an average price of $2,228. Buterin dumped a total of 2,961.5 Ethereum from his wallet, according to the data published by Lookonchain . “Selling is still going on,” wrote the on-chain metrics firm on X. This means that the Ethereum founder is not done dumping ETH and is continuing the selling. Therefore, ETH has more chances of heading south as the bigwigs and other whales are taking profits. “Vitalik.eth (VitalikButerin) is dumping ETH fast!” wrote Lookonchain. “Over the past 3 days, Vitalik has sold 2,961.5 ETH($6.6 million) at an average price of $2,228, and the selling is still ongoing.” The sell-off came at a time when Ethereum was losing technical support and continued through the breakdown. ETH will remain under pressure this week due to weak sentiments in the charts. Also Read: Ethereum Rethinks Layer-2? Vitalik Flouts New Roadmap as Price Drops Ethereum’s Price Under Pressure After Vitalik Buterin’s Sell-Off Source: Pixabay Ethereum’s price is already under pressure as it dipped 34% in a month. The fall has been sharp, allowing no room for an upward trajectory. Buterin’s sell-off reinforces bearish signals, and commentators are predicting that ETH could crash to $1,800 next. The high-profile selling, combined with the market weakness, is brewing a recipe for disaster. The sell-off also comes at a time when the Ethereum founder questioned the impact of layer-2 solutions on the industry. He explained that layer-1 blockchains are scaling up at a faster rate while L2 is severely lagging. Buterin also stressed the importance of decentralization, which is lacking in L2 networks. The statements have ruffled a lot of feathers in the broader cryptocurrency market.
